conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on both blocks A and B.
Block A is on an inclined plane with an angle of 30°.
Forces on block A: gravitational force, normal force, tension in the rope.
Resolve gravitational force on block A into components: mg sin(30°) parallel and mg cos(30°) perpendicular.
For block A to be stationary, T = mg sin(30°).
Forces on block B: gravitational force m_B g, tension T.
For block B to be stationary, T = m_B g.
Equate tensions: mg sin(30°) = m_B g.
Solve for m_B: m_B = m sin(30°).
The mass of block B is m/2.
